## Public Member Functions

### fuseLoops() {#a3ce251220e1d2d9ea7bcc51ffa076a22}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;LoopFuse.cpp&#125;::LoopFuser::fuseLoops (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function">Function</a> &amp; F)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
This is the main entry point for loop fusion.

It will traverse the specified function and collect candidate loops to fuse, starting at the outermost nesting level and working inwards.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/loopfuse-cpp/#l00589">589</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/loopfuse-cpp">LoopFuse.cpp</a>.

### collectFusionCandidates() {#a5dd2353449adf65146830ce2f61c9b63}

### dependencesAllowFusion() {#aa849789733ae6ff21ad54a32643c279c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;LoopFuse.cpp&#125;::LoopFuser::dependencesAllowFusion (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-loopfuse-cpp-/fusioncandidate">FusionCandidate</a> &amp; FC0, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-loopfuse-cpp-/fusioncandidate">FusionCandidate</a> &amp; FC1, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &amp; I0, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &amp; I1, bool AnyDep, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/loopfuse-cpp/#ab2ce98edbf00ac5582eba4ec2630b50b">FusionDependenceAnalysisChoice</a> DepChoice)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Return true if the dependences between <code>I0</code> (in <code>L0</code>) and <code>I1</code> (in <code>L1</code>) allow loop fusion of <code>L0</code> and <code>L1</code>.

The dependence analyses specified by <code>DepChoice</code> are used to determine this.

### fuseCandidates() {#a5711fd429c82c37cb28f6bb605263a27}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;LoopFuse.cpp&#125;::LoopFuser::fuseCandidates ()</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Walk each set of control flow equivalent fusion candidates and attempt to fuse them.

This does a single linear traversal of all candidates in the set. The conditions for legal fusion are checked at this point. If a pair of fusion candidates passes all legality checks, they are fused together and a new fusion candidate is created and added to the <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-loopfuse-cpp-/#a8974eb1cd0d99da470c576c3b3388bf6">FusionCandidateSet</a>. The original fusion candidates are then removed, as they are no longer valid.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/loopfuse-cpp/#l00857">857</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/loopfuse-cpp">LoopFuse.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### fuseGuardedLoops() {#a8825f42be24b54d0f7cebf785d797672}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Loop &#42; anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;LoopFuse.cpp&#125;::LoopFuser::fuseGuardedLoops (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-loopfuse-cpp-/fusioncandidate">FusionCandidate</a> &amp; FC0, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-loopfuse-cpp-/fusioncandidate">FusionCandidate</a> &amp; FC1)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Fuse two guarded fusion candidates, creating a new fused loop.

Fusing guarded loops is handled much the same way as fusing non-guarded loops. The rewiring of the CFG is slightly different though, because of the presence of the guards around the loops and the exit blocks after the loop body. As such, the new loop is rewired as follows:
<ul>
<li>Keep the guard branch from FC0 and use the non-loop block target from the FC1 guard branch.</li>
<li>Remove the exit block from FC0 (this exit block should be empty right now).</li>
<li>Remove the guard branch for FC1</li>
<li>Remove the preheader for FC1. The exit block successor for the latch of FC0 is updated to be the header of FC1 and the non-exit block successor of the latch of FC1 is updated to be the header of FC0, thus creating the fused loop.</li>
</ul>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/loopfuse-cpp/#l01815">1815</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/loopfuse-cpp">LoopFuse.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### haveIdenticalGuards() {#a067d7d87dd0e9626f6873a870f2669b7}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;LoopFuse.cpp&#125;::LoopFuser::haveIdenticalGuards (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-loopfuse-cpp-/fusioncandidate">FusionCandidate</a> &amp; FC0, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-loopfuse-cpp-/fusioncandidate">FusionCandidate</a> &amp; FC1) const</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Determine if two fusion candidates have identical guards.

This method will determine if two fusion candidates have the same guards. The guards are considered the same if:
<ul>
<li>The instructions to compute the condition used in the compare are identical.</li>
<li>The successors of the guard have the same flow into/around the loop. If the compare instructions are identical, then the first successor of the guard must go to the same place (either the preheader of the loop or the NonLoopBlock). In other words, the first successor of both loops must both go into the loop (i.e., the preheader) or go around the loop (i.e., the NonLoopBlock). The same must be true for the second successor.</li>
</ul>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/loopfuse-cpp/#l01497">1497</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/loopfuse-cpp">LoopFuse.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### haveIdenticalTripCounts() {#ae676c45652dfb7654743768f0c9ffd7e}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::pair&lt; bool, std::optional&lt; unsigned &gt; &gt; anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;LoopFuse.cpp&#125;::LoopFuser::haveIdenticalTripCounts (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-loopfuse-cpp-/fusioncandidate">FusionCandidate</a> &amp; FC0, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-loopfuse-cpp-/fusioncandidate">FusionCandidate</a> &amp; FC1) const</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Determine if two fusion candidates have the same trip count (i.e., they execute the same number of iterations).

This function will return a pair of values. The first is a boolean, stating whether or not the two candidates are known at compile time to have the same TripCount. The second is the difference in the two TripCounts. This information can be used later to determine whether or not peeling can be performed on either one of the candidates.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/loopfuse-cpp/#l00727">727</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/loopfuse-cpp">LoopFuse.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### isAdjacent() {#ab3cc552627ead496e41304b6a7f97edf}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;LoopFuse.cpp&#125;::LoopFuser::isAdjacent (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-loopfuse-cpp-/fusioncandidate">FusionCandidate</a> &amp; FC0, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-loopfuse-cpp-/fusioncandidate">FusionCandidate</a> &amp; FC1) const</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Determine if two fusion candidates are adjacent in the CFG.

This method will determine if there are additional basic blocks in the CFG between the exit of <code>FC0</code> and the entry of <code>FC1</code>. If the two candidates are guarded loops, then it checks whether the non-loop successor of the <code>FC0</code> guard branch is the entry block of <code>FC1</code>. If not, then the loops are not adjacent. If the two candidates are not guarded loops, then it checks whether the exit block of <code>FC0</code> is the preheader of <code>FC1</code>.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/loopfuse-cpp/#l01435">1435</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/loopfuse-cpp">LoopFuse.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

Determine if it is beneficial to fuse two loops.

For now, this method simply returns true because we want to fuse as much as possible (primarily to test the pass). This method will evolve, over time, to add heuristics for profitability of fusion.

### isControlFlowEquivalent() {#a05c30accd81ec61fed4720ced9128ac4}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;LoopFuse.cpp&#125;::LoopFuser::isControlFlowEquivalent (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-loopfuse-cpp-/fusioncandidate">FusionCandidate</a> &amp; FC0, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-loopfuse-cpp-/fusioncandidate">FusionCandidate</a> &amp; FC1) const</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Determine if two fusion candidates are control flow equivalent.

Two fusion candidates are control flow equivalent if when one executes, the other is guaranteed to execute. This is determined using dominators and post-dominators: if A dominates B and B post-dominates A then A and B are control-flow equivalent.

### performFusion() {#afb3f820bc8f2f50d63c2754583bea46e}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Loop &#42; anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;LoopFuse.cpp&#125;::LoopFuser::performFusion (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-loopfuse-cpp-/fusioncandidate">FusionCandidate</a> &amp; FC0, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-loopfuse-cpp-/fusioncandidate">FusionCandidate</a> &amp; FC1)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Fuse two fusion candidates, creating a new fused loop.

This method contains the mechanics of fusing two loops, represented by <code>FC0</code> and <code>FC1</code>. It is assumed that <code>FC0</code> dominates <code>FC1</code> and <code>FC1</code> postdominates <code>FC0</code> (making them control flow equivalent). It also assumes that the other conditions for fusion have been met: adjacent, identical trip counts, and no negative distance dependencies exist that would prevent fusion. Thus, there is no checking for these conditions in this method.

Fusion is performed by rewiring the CFG to update successor blocks of the components of tho loop. Specifically, the following changes are done:


<ul>
<li>The preheader of <code>FC1</code> is removed as it is no longer necessary (because it is currently only a single statement block).</li>
<li>The latch of <code>FC0</code> is modified to jump to the header of <code>FC1</code>.</li>
<li>The latch of <code>FC1</code> i modified to jump to the header of <code>FC0</code>.</li>
<li>All blocks from <code>FC1</code> are removed from FC1 and added to FC0.</li>
</ul>


All of these modifications are done with dominator tree updates, thus keeping the dominator (and post dominator) information up-to-date.

This can be improved in the future by actually merging blocks during fusion. For example, the preheader of <code>FC1</code> can be merged with the preheader of <code>FC0</code>. This would allow loops with more than a single statement in the preheader to be fused. Similarly, the latch blocks of the two loops could also be fused into a single block. This will require analysis to prove it is safe to move the contents of the block past existing code, which currently has not been implemented.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/loopfuse-cpp/#l01571">1571</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/loopfuse-cpp">LoopFuse.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### reportLoopFusion() {#a11c1d751ede6c549a897fa4ccd9235af}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename RemarkKind&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>void anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;LoopFuse.cpp&#125;::LoopFuser::reportLoopFusion (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-loopfuse-cpp-/fusioncandidate">FusionCandidate</a> &amp; FC0, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-loopfuse-cpp-/fusioncandidate">FusionCandidate</a> &amp; FC1, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a6412c3ea6550f1aeab7571b6d38a2bf3">llvm::Statistic</a> &amp; Stat)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Report details on loop fusion opportunities.

This template function can be used to report both successful and missed loop fusion opportunities, based on the RemarkKind. The RemarkKind should be one of:
<ul>
<li><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/optimizationremarkmissed">OptimizationRemarkMissed</a> to report when loop fusion is unsuccessful given two valid fusion candidates.</li>
<li><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/optimizationremark">OptimizationRemark</a> to report successful fusion of two fusion candidates. The remarks will be printed using the form: &lt;path/filename&gt;:&lt;line number&gt;:&lt;column number&gt;: &#91;&lt;function name&gt;&#93;: &lt;Cand1 Preheader&gt; and &lt;Cand2 Preheader&gt;: &lt;Stat Description&gt;</li>
</ul>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/loopfuse-cpp/#l01784">1784</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/loopfuse-cpp">LoopFuse.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### ORE {#a1d5a40178b406bb47a7f64165b941ebc}
